Wisdom: آفَةُ السَّخَاءِ الْمَنُّ
enWisdom: The bane of generosity is obligation

Wisdom: آفَةُ الْمَجْدِ عَوَائِقُ الْقَضَاءِ
enWisdom: The impediments of divine decree are the bane of eminence

Wisdom: آفَةُ الْعَطَاءِ الْمَطَلُ
enWisdom: The bane of giving is procrastination

Wisdom: آفَةُ الْجُودِ الْفَقْرُ
enWisdom: The bane of generosity is poverty

Wisdom: آفَةُ الْجُودِ التَّبْذِيرُ
enWisdom: The bane of generosity is wastefulness

Wisdom: أَحْيُوا الْمَعْرُوفَ بِإِمَاتَتِهِ فَإِنَّ الْمِنَّةَ تَهْدِمُ الصَّنِيعَةَ
enWisdom: Give life to the benevolent act by killing it [ieforgetting it], for verily the sense of obligation destroys a good turn

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْعَطَاءِ تَرْكُ الْمَنِّ
enWisdom: The best gift is forgoing obligation

Wisdom: الْكَرَمُ بَرِي‏ءٌ مِنَ الْحَسَدِ
enWisdom: Nobleness is [being] free from jealousy

Wisdom: الطَّعَامُ يُؤْكَلُ عَلَى ثَلَاثَةِ أَضْرُبٍ مَعَ الْإِخْوَانِ بِالسُّرُورِ وَمَعَ الْفُقَرَاءِ بِالْإِيثَارِ وَمَعَ أَبْنَاءِ الدُّنْيَا بِالْمُرُوءَةِ
enWisdom: Food is eaten and shared with three groups [in three situations]: alongside brothers with happiness, alongside the poor with selflessness and alongside the children of this world with magnanimity

Wisdom: الْكَرِيمُ يَزْدَجِرُ عَمَّا يَفْتَخِرُ بِهِ اللَّئِيمُ
enWisdom: A noble-minded person is repulsed by that which the wicked take pride in

Wisdom: الْحَجَرُ الْغَصْبُ فِي الدَّارِ رَهْنٌ لِخَرَابِهَا
enWisdom: ne usurped stone in a house is the guaranty of its ruin

Wisdom: الْكَرِيمُ يَجْفُو إِذَا عُنِّفَ وَيَلِينُ إِذَا اسْتُعْطِفَ
enWisdom: The munificent one cuts off his favour when he is approached harshly and is soft [and kind] when he is entreated [politely]

Wisdom: الْكَرِيمُ يَرْفَعُ نَفْسَهُ فِي كُلِّ مَا أَسْدَاهُ عَنْ حُسْنِ الْمُجَازَاةِ
enWisdom: The noble-minded person raises himself above [the expectation of] rewards in everything good that he does

Wisdom: الْكَرِيمُ إِذَا احْتَاجَ إِلَيْكَ أَعْفَاكَ وَإِذَا احْتَجْتَ إِلَيْهِ كَفَاكَ
enWisdom: When a noble-minded person needs you he excuses you [from helping him] and when you need him he suffices you

Wisdom: الْجُودُ مِنْ غَيْرِ خَوْفٍ وَلَا رَجَاءِ مُكَافَاةٍ حَقِيقَةُ الْجُودِ
enWisdom: Generosity without fear or hope of recompense is true generosity

Wisdom: الْمَنْعُ الْجَمِيلُ أَحْسَنُ مِنَ الْوَعْدِ الطَّوِيلِ
enWisdom: A polite refusal is better than a protracted promise

Wisdom: ابْذُلْ مَعْرُوفَكَ وَكُفَّ أَذَاكَ
enWisdom: Extend your goodness and do no harm

Wisdom: أَعْطِ مَا تُعْطِيهِ مُعَجَّلًا مُهَنَّأً وَإِنْ مَنَعْتَ فَلْيَكُنْ فِي إِجْمَالٍ وَإِعْذَارٍ
enWisdom: Give whatever you are giving expeditiously and beneficially, and if you refuse then let it be with politeness and apology

Wisdom: ابْذُلْ مَالَكَ لِمَنْ بَذَلَ لَكَ وَجْهَهُ فَإِنَّ بَذْلَ الْوَجْهِ لَا يُوَازِيهِ [لَا يُوَازِنُهُ‏] شَيْ‏ءٌ
enWisdom: Give your wealth generously to the one who has sacrificed his self-respect for you, for indeed the sacrificing of self-respect cannot be matched by anything

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْكَرَمِ إِتْمَامُ النِّعَمِ
enWisdom: The most excellent munificence is completing [one’s] favours

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْجُودِ بَذْلُ الْمَوْجُودِ
enWisdom: The greatest generosity is being open-handed with whatever is available

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْجُودِ إِيصَالُ الْحُقُوقِ إِلَى أَهْلِهَا
enWisdom: The greatest generosity is delivering the rights to their [rightful] owners

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْجُودِ مَا كَانَ عَنْ عُسْرَةٍ
enWisdom: The greatest generosity is giving despite [facing] hard times

Wisdom: إِنَّ سَخَاءَ النَّفْسِ عَمَّا فِي أَيْدِي النَّاسِ لَأَفْضَلُ مِنْ سَخَاءِ الْبَذْلِ
enWisdom: Verily the generosity of keeping oneself away from that which others possess is better than the generosity of giving

Wisdom: إِذَا أَعْطَيْتَ فَأَوْجِزْ
enWisdom: When you [wish to] give, be quick

Wisdom: إِذَا أَطْعَمْتَ [طمعت‏] فَأَشْبِعْ
enWisdom: When you feed [someone] then satiate him

Wisdom: بَذْلُ الْعَطَاءِ زَكَاةُ النَّعْمَاءِ
enWisdom: Giving generously is the alms-tax of blessings

Wisdom: بَذْلُ الْجَاهِ زَكَاةُ الْجَاهِ
enWisdom: Being generous with power [and fulfilling the needs of the people with it] is the alms-tax of power

Wisdom: خَيْرُ السَّخَاءِ مَا صَادَفَ مَوْضِعَ الْحَاجَةِ
enWisdom: The best generosity is that which corresponds to the situations of need

Wisdom: ظَفَرُ الْكَرِيمِ يُنْجِي
enWisdom: The success of a noble-minded person brings deliverance

Wisdom: غَايَةُ الْجُودِ بَذْلُ الْمَوْجُودِ
enWisdom: The highest extent of generosity is giving [from] whatever is available

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَيْسُورِ رِفْداً
enWisdom: It is enough of a donation to give what is [readily] available

Wisdom: كَمَالُ الْعَطِيَّةِ تَعْجِيلُهَا
enWisdom: The perfection of giving is in expediting it

Wisdom: لَيْسَ مِنْ عَادَةِ الْكِرَامِ تَأْخِيرُ الْإِنْعَامِ
enWisdom: It is not from the practice of the virtuous to delay the bestowal of favours

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ تُقَوِّمْهُ الْكَرَامَةُ قَوَّمَتْهُ الْإِهَانَةُ
enWisdom: One who is not set aright by high esteem is put right by indignity

Wisdom: مَنْ قَبِلَ عَطَاءَكَ [عَطَاكَ‏] فَقَدْ أَعَانَكَ عَلَى الْكَرَمِ
enWisdom: One who accepts your gift has [actually] assisted you in gaining honour

Wisdom: مَنْ أَعْطَى فِي غَيْرِ الْحُقُوقِ قَصَّرَ عَنِ‏ الْحُقُوقِ
enWisdom: One who gives in cases that are undeserving fails to give [the rights] to those who are deserving

Wisdom: مِنَ الْكَرَمِ إِتْمَامُ النِّعَمِ
enWisdom: Completion of favours is part of munificence

Wisdom: مِنْ كَمَالِ الْكَرَمِ تَعْجِيلُ الْمَثُوبَةِ
enWisdom: From the perfection of munificence is hastening [to give] reward

Wisdom: مِنْ تَمَامِ الْكَرَمِ إِتْمَامُ النِّعَمِ
enWisdom: Completing [one’s] favours is from the perfection of munificence

Wisdom: مِنَ الِاقْتِصَادِ سَخَاءٌ بِغَيْرِ سَرَفٍ وَمُرُوَّةٌ مِنْ غَيْرِ تَلَفٍ
enWisdom: Being generous without extravagance and magnanimous without wastefulness is part of moderation

Wisdom: مَا أَوْحَشَ كَرِيمٌ
enWisdom: The munificent person is never deserted

Wisdom: لَا تَسْتَكْثِرَنَّ الْعَطَاءَ وَإِنْ كَثُرَ فَإِنَّ حُسْنَ الثَّنَاءِ أَكْثَرُ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: Never regard what you give as too much, even if it is plenty, for indeed the good praise [you will get for your generosity] will be greater than it

Wisdom: لَا تَسْتَعْظِمَنَّ النَّوَالَ وَإِنْ عَظُمَ فَإِنَّ قَدْرَ السُّؤَالِ أَعْظَمُ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: Never regard what you give as great, even if it is substantial, for indeed the extent of [humiliation undergone through] begging is greater than that

Wisdom: لَا تَسْتَحْيِ مِنْ إِعْطَاءِ الْقَلِيلِ فَإِنَّ الْحِرْمَانَ أَقَلُّ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: Do not be ashamed of giving little, for not giving at all is even less than that

Wisdom: لَا تَسْتَكْثِرَنَّ الْكَثِيرَ مِنْ نَوَالِكَ فَإِنَّكَ أَكْثَرُ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: Never regard the abundance of what you have given to be much, for you are [in possession of] even more than that

Wisdom: لَا سَخَاءَ مَعَ عَدَمٍ
enWisdom: There can be no generosity with nothingness

Wisdom: يَحْتَاجُ ذُو النَّائِلِ إِلَى السَّائِلِ
enWisdom: The charitable one needs the beggar
